name: soft-serve
description: Soft Serve is a self-hosted, TUI-first Git server and code forge. It exposes repositories via SSH with a retro terminal UI, and optionally serves a minimal web view.
features: Git server: Hosts Git repositories with SSH access.
TUI interface: Browses repositories and code through terminal user interface.
SSH authentication: Authenticates users via SSH keys for secure access.
Repository browsing: Views files, commits, and branches in terminal.
Markdown rendering: Displays README files with formatted markdown in terminal.
Syntax highlighting: Shows code with language-specific highlighting in TUI.
Web interface: Optionally serves minimal web view for repository browsing.
User management: Controls repository access with user permissions.
Git hooks: Supports server-side Git hooks for automation.
Clone and push: Provides standard Git operations via SSH.
Lightweight: Runs efficiently with minimal resource requirements.
Self-contained: Single binary deployment without external dependencies.
